title: Coronavirus cases and vaccine sites in Kent, Sussex and Surrey
article: There have been more than 15,684,700 confirmed cases of coronavirus so far in England and more than 139,220 people have died, government figures show. For information about vaccines in the South East, you can clickhere for Kent and Medway ,here for East Sussex ,here for West Sussex ,here for Brighton and Hove andhere for Surrey . Below is a table of local authority areas in Kent, Sussex and Surrey, showing how many people have tested positive for coronavirus in the week leading up to 11 February. For a detailed look at coronavirus where you live, use the BBC's postcode checker: Follow BBC South East on Facebook , on Twitter , and on Instagram . Send your story ideas to southeasttoday@bbc.co.uk.
